snippet: When it comes to being a celebrity, Alec Baldwin brings a little bit of everything to the table.
abstract: Lee Siegel essay holds that in America, where the average, unprivileged individual enjoys more opportunities for gratification than in any previous society, celebrities have become a symbolic test case for the idea of having carte blanche to act as one pleases; Alec Baldwin is a case in point for the latest hope in America--that one can fulfill one's wildest dreams and still be seen as a nice guy.
lead_paragraph: When it comes to being a celebrity, Alec Baldwin brings a little bit of everything to the table.

headline.seo: On Celebrities Good and Bad, or Alec Baldwin
headline.main: On Celebrities Good and Bad, or Alec Baldwin
headline.print_headline: On Celebrities Good and Bad, or Both
